senses.sense_definition: A movable bar placed across the fingerboard of a guitar and used to raise the pitch of all strings.

examples.text: She attached a <w>capo</w> to the second fret to suit her vocal range.
You will need to use a <w>capo</w> if you want to play along with the original recording.

senses.sense_definition: A high-ranking member or leader in the Mafia; a caporegime.

examples.text: The <w>capo</w> was responsible for managing a crew of soldiers within the crime family.
Police investigations revealed that the <w>capo</w> had ordered the illegal operation.

senses.sense_definition: A leader and organizer of supporters at a sporting event, particularly association football matches.

examples.text: Standing on the fence with a megaphone, the <w>capo</w> directed the crowd's chants.
The ultras waited for the <w>capo</w> to signal the start of the next song.
He was forced to work as a <w>capo</w> in the labor camp during the war.
The prisoners feared the <w>capo</w> who was in charge of their barracks.

senses.sense_definition: Abbreviation of contract agreement purchase order.

examples.text: Please ensure the <w>capo</w> is signed before we ship the goods.
The finance department needs a copy of the <w>capo</w> for their records.
We have a meeting scheduled with Mr. <w>Capo</w> this afternoon.
The letter was addressed to the <w>Capo</w> family.
